Create a dataset - datafactory module

Note

You can create a corpus and its Tfidf model using the script read4me/scripts/make_corpus.py. From the activated environment, call the script with the -h flag to see the help page:

(venv) user@userpc:~$ python -m read4me.scripts.make_corpus -h

The parameters used by the script are coherent with the parameters used in this module, see below for more information.

Preliminary information.

With the datafactory module you can build a corpus of text documents, using the News Dataset repository of the open CommonCrawl Project.

What classes are there?

  • DataPaths: A metadata container used to initialize a CorpusBuilder instance.

  • CorpusBuilder: The corpus generator.

How can you use it?

Note

To start building a corpus you need to download and extract one index file from the list of monthly News Dataset indexes at https://data.commoncrawl.org/crawl-data/CC-NEWS/index.html. An index file contains a list of partial URLs for a month worth of news articles. Initializing a DataPaths instance with the index will also complete the URLs with a valid prefix.

The extracted dataset files and the corpus files are stored respectively as text and pickle files inside a dedicated directory of your choice. The text files contain the original documents as extracted from the archives, one for each line, without duplicates, while the pickle files contain the processed texts in binary format for easy memory loading.

Building and loading the corpus can be done in few steps:

  1. Define the metadata.

  2. Generate the corpus.

  3. Load and use the corpus.

1. Define the metadata.

Initialize a DataPaths instance with the index file and other information.

Example: Use an index file called “warc.paths”, select from it only the first 10 lines (archives) to be used. The designated path to save the corpus files is the directory “corpus/” and the vocabulary will be saved inside of it as “vocab.txt”. If the directory “corpus/” is not already present it will be created.

datapaths = DataPaths(
    warc_index=pathlib.Path("warc.paths"),
    range_start=0, range_stop=9,
    text_vocab=pathlib.Path("corpus/vocab.txt"),
    corpus_dir=pathlib.Path("corpus"))``

The metadata is ready.

2. Generate the corpus.

You can generate the corpus in few steps:

Initialize an instance with the metadata and then set where to save the status file. The status file contains the metadata and other information to reload the corpus once it has been generated.

cb = CorpusBuilder(datapaths)
cb.set_status_path(pathlib.Path("status.pkl"))

Download and extract the archives into txt files. The archives are those selected from the index file.

cb.generate_texts_from_index()

Process the text files and generate the corpus pickle files.

cb.load_and_clean_origin()

Save the status of the corpus into a file. The status contains all relevant information for loading the corpus. The corpus is not serialized because it is already stored separately in the pickle files.

cb.save_status()

3. Load and use the corpus.

First load the status containing the metadata, then load the corpus, using the metadata to locate the right corpus files.

cb = CorpusBuilder.load_status()
cb.load_corpus()

The corpus is formatted as a list of documents, where each document can be either a string or a list of words, the default is a list of words.

class read4me.datafactory.DataPaths(warc_index: Path, range_start: int, range_stop: int, text_vocab: Path, corpus_dir: Path)[source]

Setup of the metadata for the creation of the corpus.

Generate the list of file names of the corpus, both in txt and pickle format. Define the directory location where to save the files and the txt-vocabulary Path/name.

The file names are extracted from the index file, also called “WARC file list”, which MUST be one of those available at https://data.commoncrawl.org/crawl-data/CC-NEWS/index.html. The index file is a list of URLs suffixes for the “News Dataset”. The initialization generates valid URLs for the archives selected from the index such that the completed URLs point to downloadable archives in WARC format.

Parameters:

  • warc_index – Path to the index file.

  • range_start – Positional number of the first archive in the index to use.

  • range_stop – Positional number of the last archive in the index to use.

  • text_vocab – Path to text vocabulary file, if it exists it will be overwritten.

  • corpus_dir – Path to the corpus directory, if it doesn’t exist it will be created.

property warc_index: list[str]

Get the list of the URLs of the index.

The URLs point to downloadable warc archives from https://data.commoncrawl.org/.

Returns:

List of URLs

property text_corpus_files: list[pathlib.Path]

Get the list of the Paths for the text files of the corpus.

Returns:

List of Paths of text files.

property pkl_corpus_files: list[pathlib.Path]

Get the list of the Paths for the pickle files of the corpus.

Returns:

List of Paths of pickle files.

property text_vocab: Path

Get the Path of the vocabulary for the corpus.

Returns:

Path to the vocabulary.

property corpus_dir: Path

Get the Path of the corpus directory.

Returns:

Path of the corpus directory.

set_corpus_dir(dir_path: Path)[source]

Set the Path to the directory where the corpus will be saved. Create the directory if it does not exist.

Parameters:

dir_path – Path to the corpus directory.

class read4me.datafactory.CorpusBuilder(data_paths: DataPaths)[source]

This class is responsible for generating a normalized text corpus from the News Dataset of the CommonCrawl project. It is possible to download, extract, normalize and serialize the corpus with using an instance of this class.

Initialize a new CorpusBuilder instance.

To load a previous instance, call load_status() followed by load_corpus().

Parameters:

data_paths – DataPaths instance, metadata for the environment of the corpus.

generate_texts_from_index(check_local_archive=True, keep_archive=True, check_txt=True, min_len=50)[source]

Download the warc archives and extract their content into text files in the corpus directory.

Parameters:

  • check_local_archive – If true, download only the archives that have not been already downloaded.

  • keep_archive – Do not delete the archives after extraction.

  • check_txt – If True, download and extract only the archives for which there is not a corresponding text file in the corpus directory.

  • min_len – Minimum document length in number of words.

static extract_text_from_archive(archive: Path, text_path: Path, min_len=50)[source]

Extract the text documents from a warc archive and save it in a text file.

Each line in the text file represents a document.

Parameters:

  • archive – Archive to process.

  • text_path – Text file to write to.

  • min_len – Threshold on the minimum number of words, discard document otherwise.

load_and_clean_origin(split=True, pos: set[str] = None, stop: set[str] = None, only_missing: bool = False, n_process: int = -1)[source]

Process the raw text corpus and generate a normalized corpus. Save the normalized corpus in pickle files and generate a vocabulary for it.

Parameters:

  • split – If True, the documents are saved as list of words.

  • pos – Part of Speech set, if None use class defined one.

  • stop – Stopword set, if None use class defined one.

  • only_missing – If True, process only the text files for which there is not a corresponding pickle file.

  • n_process – Number of cores to use.

save_vocab()[source]

Generate the vocabulary from the current corpus and save it in a text file.

set_status_path(path: Path)[source]

Set the Path name for saving/loading a serialized instance of this class, without the corpus.

Setting the Path does not save the instance, use save_status() for that.

Parameters:

path – Status Path.

save_status()[source]

Save the serialized instance of this class in a pickle file, without the corpus.

classmethod load_status(path: Path) → Self[source]

Retrieve a previously serialized instance of this class.

The corpus must be loaded separately with load_corpus().

Parameters:

path – Path to status file.

Returns:

Instance of this class, without the corpus.

load_corpus(files: list[pathlib.Path] = None)[source]

Load the corpus from the list of pickle files passed as parameter.

If no list is passed as parameter, load the corpus from the pickle files defined in data_paths during initialization of the instance.

Parameters:

files – List of Paths of pickle corpus file to load.

property status_path: Path

Get the Path to use for serialization of an instance of this class.

Returns:

Path to the CorpusBuilder instance.

property data_paths: DataPaths

Get the DataPaths instance of the current instance.

DataPaths is a collection of metadata for the current CorpusBuilder instance.

Returns:

DataPaths instance.

property documents_are_split_in_words: bool

True if corpus is a list of lists of words.

Returns:

Boolean.

property corpus

Get the corpus of the current instance. The corpus can be a list of strings or a list of lists of words (default).

Returns:

List of documents.

static clean_doc(doc: str) → str[source]

Perform a sequence of regex substitutions on the given document.

Parameters:

doc – Document to clean.

Returns:

Document cleaned.

static doc_from_link(link: str) → str | None[source]

Download and extract the text body of a web page from the given URL, return None if problems during download or extraction arise.

Parameters:

link – URL link of the web page.

Returns:

Raw text body as a string or None if the document cannot be extracted.

static deduplicate_lines_in_txt(source: Path)[source]

Deduplicate lines in the source text file. This method uses awk to perform deduplication.

Parameters:

source – Path to text file.
